extendedIngredients.name: ground beef
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 lb ground beef (or a mix of 1/2 beef and 1/2 pork sausage)
metaInformation: (or a mix of 1/2 beef and 1/2 pork sausage)

extendedIngredients.name: marinara sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: a jar of your favorite marinara sauce

extendedIngredients.name: parmesan cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish

recipes.title: Spaghetti and Giant Meatballs

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

recipes.instructions: Set oven to 350FPut all the meatball ingredients in a large bowl.  Break up the meat and mix everything together with your fingertips, making sure to distribute everything evenly, without compacting the meat too much.  Form the mixture into two large meatballs.Heat olive oil in a skillet until hot, and brown the meatballs on all sides.To finish cooking the meatballs, I put them in a small oven safe pot and cover with the marinara sauce.  Cover loosely with foil and bake for about 30-40 minutes until the meat is cooked through.  A thermometer inserted i the center of a meatball should read 160F.  Serve over spaghetti, garnished with Parmesan cheese.

steps.step: Set oven to 350FPut all the meatball ingredients in a large bowl.  Break up the meat and mix everything together with your fingertips, making sure to distribute everything evenly, without compacting the meat too much.  Form the mixture into two large meatballs.

Heat olive oil in a skillet until hot, and brown the meatballs on all sides.To finish cooking the meatballs, I put them in a small oven safe pot and cover with the marinara sauce.  Cover loosely with foil and bake for about 30-40 minutes until the meat is cooked through.  A thermometer inserted i the center of a meatball should read 160F.
Serve over spaghetti, garnished with Parmesan cheese.
